Authors: Sardjono W., Wijaya C., Ciptaningsih E.M.S.S., Pujadi T.
Title: Competitive advantage strategy model in the banking industry through the implementation of the national payment gateway
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; University of Gadjahmada, Graduate Program, Master of Business Administration, Faculty of Economic and Business, Yogyakarta, Indonesia; BINUS Business School UnderGraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sardjono, W., BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, C., University of Gadjahmada, Graduate Program, Master of Business Administration, Faculty of Economic and Business, Yogyakarta, Indonesia; Ciptaningsih, E.M.S.S., BINUS Business School UnderGraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pujadi, T., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Bank Indonesia as the Central Bank of the Republic of Indonesia has the main tasks contained in the three main pillars, where the three task areas need to be integrated with the relevant parties so that the goal of maintaining the stability of the rupiah value can be achieved effectively and efficiently. In the corridor of carrying out these tasks and building a strong sovereignty of the Indonesian economic system in the future, Bank Indonesia in 2017 has established a National Payment Gateway policy through the Board of Governors' Member Regulation no. 19/10 / PADG / 2017 dated September 20, 2017 concerning the National Payment Gateway. The implementation of NPG is part of Indonesia's nationalist development strategy, therefore Bank BCA as one of the Anchor Banks in Indonesia has a very strategic role in implementing this policy. This research will analyze the challenges faced by BCA in implementing a competitive advantage strategy in order to implement the National Payment Gateway policy. The results of this study are as follows: (1) Identifying problems in NPG implementation (2) Building NPG models and conditions for companies using the theory of Resource Based View, Value Chain, Factor Analysis and VRIO (3) Planning the company's competitive advantage strategy in implementing NPG. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Competitive advantage; Implementation model; Management strategy; National payment gateway
Index Keywords: Information management; Banking industry; Competitive advantage; Development strategies; Economic system; Payment gateways; Resource-based view; Strategic role; Strategy modeling; Competition

Authors: Sardjono W., Harisno, Perdana W.G., Pujadi T., Iskandar K.
Title: Critical success factor measurement model implementation of natural disaster mitigation knowledge management systems
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Post Graduate Program, School of Environmental Science, University of Infonesia, Jakarta, Indonesia; School of Information Systems, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Computer Science, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sardjono, W., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Harisno, Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Perdana, W.G., Post Graduate Program, School of Environmental Science, University of Infonesia, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pujadi, T., School of Information Systems, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Iskandar, K., School of Computer Science, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In Law Number 24 Year 2007 concerning Disaster Management, it is stated that the central government and regional governments are responsible for implementing disaster management, with an emphasis on preparedness and mitigation in dealing with natural disasters, but the socialization of these two matters is not regulated in the law exist, so that the planning and implementation of the socialization and internalization program must be carried out by the community itself. Exposure in this paper aims to provide an overview of how socialization of mitigation in dealing with natural disasters carried out by the use of information systems and technology can be successful with reference to the theory of SECI (Socialization, Externalization, Combination, and Internalization), knowledge development with data formed based on the perspective of the community. Factor analysis method is used to look for the success factors of mitigation socialization in the face of natural disasters. Furthermore, from the new factors that are formed, further analysis is carried out with a regression analysis method to develop a successful model of disaster mitigation socialization expected.The results of the study provide a number of new factors that can be represented as variables of community awareness of natural disasters, mitigation socialization processes in the face of natural disasters, availability of systems and information technology, and knowledge management governance on natural disaster mitigation. The conclusion obtained from this study is that the momentum of the industrial revolution era 4.0 can be utilized to support the socialization process of natural disaster mitigation independently measured based on the local wisdom of the local community. © 2020 Author(s).
Author Keywords: knowledge management systems; mitigation activities; natural disasters; SECI Model; socialization

Title: Evaluation Factors influencing the use Cloud Computing in the Company
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pujadi, T., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sardjono, W., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In recent years, cloud computing technology has been widely used by companies. However, they need to consider various factors that influence to decision using of the technology. This study analyzes the factors that influence the use of cloud computing in companies, which are the ease of use, usefulness, profitability and compatibility of these technologies. This study analyzes the correlation between each factor and the use of technology through the Theory of Technological Acceptance (TAM), the theory of the diffusion of innovation (DOI), principal component analysis (PCA) and ANOVA, statistical methods. The results of this study are the ease of use, usefulness, the profitability and the compatibility factors that influence and correlate with the use of cloud computing in the company. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: cloud computing; compatibility; cost effectiveness; DOI; ease of use; TAM; usefulness
Index Keywords: Analysis of variance (ANOVA); Cloud computing; Cost effectiveness; Information management; Principal component analysis; Profitability; Cloud computing technologies; compatibility; Diffusion of innovations; Ease-of-use; Evaluation factor; usefulness; Computation theory

Title: Evaluation of Knowledge Management System for Disaster Management Using Factor Analysis
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pujadi, T., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sardjono, W., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: To accelerate the process of improving public knowledge about disaster management, the process of knowledge transfer process can be done in several ways, for example through training, courses, seminars, workshops and socialization. The implementation of the method of knowledge transfer in disaster risk reduction includes seismic disaster type, volcanic eruption, lava, landslides, floods, flash floods, tsunamis and droughts. Includes recognition of emergency response, rehabilitation and reconstruction, preparedness, prevention, mitigation and disaster management and vulnerability management. Knowledge Management Systems (KMS) allows collaborating on disaster management issues, sharing information on risk reduction activities, warning systems, handling emergencies, all of which reduce the impact of disasters. The purpose of this study was to observe the factors that influence the performance of a disaster KMS. The study involved 240 respondents and sampling was done by proportional random sampling. The results show that the evaluation models can be constructed through the function of the factors, the organizational culture and the information through KMS, the support and participation of the administration, the accessibility and the updates and the monitoring of the information. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Early warning systems using dynamics system for social empowerment society environment
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pujadi, T., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Early warning for disaster risk reduction should be carried out accurately using advanced techniques. The key to the success of this system is to build awareness of warning risks, build relationships with stakeholders, and strive to improve the capacity of the authorities and increase public awareness to react well to disasters. To accelerate community resilience in the face of disasters, the process of knowledge transfer is conducted in various ways, including through skills training, courses, seminars, workshops and simulations using guidelines, standard of care, practical experience, local knowledge, and with various media such as face to face. The method consists of four stages of causal diagrams, making flow diagrams, simulations, and validation of simulation results. By performing simulations to disaster risk reduction at the community, in an emergency when a disaster events, as well as other conditions associated with anticipation and mitigation. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Early Warning; Social Environment; System Dynamics
Index Keywords: Knowledge management; Public risks; Community resiliences; Disaster risk reductions; Early warning; Early Warning System; Practical experience; Social environment; Society environment; System Dynamics; Disasters

Title: Performance evaluation of systems Managed File Transfer in banking industry using IT Balanced Scorecard
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sardjono, W., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pujadi, T., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Enormous file exchange in enterprise company is a common thing especially in financial company. The use and implementation of Managed File Transfer (MFT) system in company should bring a big perfomance and security impact for IT Division internally or externally. Succesful rate, perfomance rate, and supporting factor became the root cause of this research. Within this research, we know all the key-factor of perfomance measurement of MFT system and give us a blueprint about the perfomance measurement itself. This research will evaluate the perfomance of MFT system using concept of IT Balanced Scorecard (IT BSC) that have 4 perspective which will be the reference to collect data, evaluate data, and do a factor analysis using the data from the questioner. The result of factor analysis generating 4 new factor that have an important role in the MFT system level performance in the company such as System Securities, Business Support from MFT System, System Weaknesses, and System User's Comfortable. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: IT Balanced Scorecard (IT BSC); Managed File Transfer (MFT); Perfomance evaluation
Index Keywords: Information management; Multivariant analysis; Balanced scorecards; Business support; Enterprise companies; File transfers; Financial companies; Perfomance; Supporting factors; System-level performance; Factor analysis

Authors: Pujadi T., Fathurrozi A., Theresia S.
Title: Using Analytical Hierarchy Process for the decision support system in teacher placement
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: Departement of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pujadi, T., Departement of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Fathurrozi, A., Departement of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Theresia, S., Departement of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aimed to support the effectiveness and efficiency of employee performance in the Provincial Education Office (Dinas Pendidikan) regarding teacher placements in elementary school, middle school, and high school. Three provinces are chosen as samples: Bali, Yogyakarta, and DKI Jakarta. The employee performance assessment was conducted using criteria and weight calculation regarding teacher's content knowledge, educational background, grade, rank, age, and participation in teacher trainings. The analysis method used to assess teacher performance in this study was Analytical Hierarchy Process (AHP) with Expert Choice software. The result of this analysis was used to design the DSS-Based Teacher Management Model. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: analytical hierarchy Process (AHP); decision support system; performance; Teacher
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Decision support systems; Education; Hierarchical systems; Information management; Personnel rating; Analytical Hierarchy Process; Content knowledge; Effectiveness and efficiencies; Elementary schools; Employee performance; performance; Teacher; Weight calculation; Teaching
